channel.title: Sued By Jagex?
channel.description: Is it true there is a possibility of getting sued by jagex for making servers, posting them, running them etc?

item.title: Sued By Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:41, topic:191422”][quote author=Larzon link=topic=255044.msg2137109#msg2137109 date=1206574571]
and thay must agree the therms when accesing the site i dont think thay can just ignore them…
[/quote]

Sure they can. Just scroll to the bottom, check a check box, and click the “next” button.[/quote]
Definitely not, considering we’re not breaking any of their TOS, right? [/sarcasm]

Read full topic

item.title: Sued By Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Larzon Larzon
item.description:
@Larzon wrote:

Yes, its illigal!
and i wont be suprised when jagex just sues someone to scare
the heck out of us :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 26, 2008, 12:37:56 PM[/size][hr]and thay must agree the therms when accesing the site i dont think thay can just ignore them…[quote=“skullman25, post:19, topic:191422”][quote author=killakj link=topic=255044.msg2128321#msg2128321 date=1206237309]
don’t they have people from jagex xhecking out moparscape?
[/quote]
Most Likely. The only thing they can do about it though are the Clients, wich are property of them. they cant own the servers, they are not made by them.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Sued By Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Blapmanjr Blapmanjr
item.description:
@Blapmanjr wrote:

Making a private server is illegal and they probarbly could sue you but they wouldnt, jagex has 1,000,000 members paying for membership each month. they earn around £3,000,000-£5,000,000 a month. Plus money from advertisements. and they loose money from workers and bills too. Also jagex arent really bothered about private server’s. i was talking to mod dave and i mentioned private servers(i didnt give any names or information on mopar) and he said that the jagex dosent really care about private servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Sued By Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

TeleNubby:

Thug, I dont think Jagex would have cared about StorkPK as much if they didnt have a copy of their client on Stork’s site. Because, in theory, developing and running a server shouldn’t get you into trouble. Its completely legal to make something yourself from the bottom up, but its illegal if you are reverse engineering the RS2 client. Anyways, Jagex would have to prove you reverse engineered it too.

Uhm what…? They have their protocol copyrighted as well… And who said this is only about RS2? This includes RSC.

[quote=“skullman25, post:19, topic:191422”][quote author=killakj link=topic=255044.msg2128321#msg2128321 date=1206237309]
don’t they have people from jagex xhecking out moparscape?
[/quote]
Most Likely. The only thing they can do about it though are the Clients, wich are property of them. they cant own the servers, they are not made by them.[/quote]
protocol.

billygotshot:

Servers and running them is not illegal mainly because you did not steal it from jagex. However the client is probably illegal because that was reverse engineered to make the ones we use now.

protocol.

[quote=“f 2 p 2 p f, post:33, topic:191422”]There are way to many servers for them to bother about apart the fact that they are 99% glitchy.
Jagex don’t care about rs private servers, and if you live in a country with hardly any copyright laws all they can do is threaten.[/quote]
no.

[quote=Jagex Terms and Conditions]Intellectual property rights
Jagex®, RuneScape® and FunOrb® are registered trade marks of Jagex Limited in the United Kingdom, the United States and other countries.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).

Materials (including without limit all information, software, data, text, photographs, graphics, sound and video) placed on any Jagex Product by us or on our behalf are protected by copyright and other intellectual property rights of ourselves or our business partners / suppliers / advertisers. You may not use these materials or any Jagex Product except in accordance with these terms and conditions and for personal (i.e. non-commercial) use only.

Read full topic

pk4pk:

Jagex makes way more than what they spend, imagine…3/4 out of a regular 2million players multiplie that by $6 as some don’t pay by credit than the webhosting and domain and coders…even tho there coders are paid a bit like E30,000 a year (Idk how to do E sign)and the ads

Don’t forget the huge bandwidth bills and the hundreds of servers…

item.title: Sued By Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:25, topic:191422”][quote author=God Of Legend link=topic=255044.msg2129561#msg2129561 date=1206263308]
Thanks alot for all the feed back. Just one more thing, Is it also illegal to run a site like moparscape?
[/quote]

If it was im pretty sure it would of been shut down already.[/quote]

It is illegal, if you host copyrighted material.

The thing is, in all cases you might not necessarily be breaking the law directly, but JaGeX can afford 10x better lawyers than you can, and if they wanted to they could sue you for just about anything they wanted.

Read full topic
